content.title: Grant of Quality Certification Reimbursement of Charges
content.department: Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department
content.details: The scheme 'Grant of Quality Certification Reimbursement of Charges' by the Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department, Government of Tamil Nadu, is introduced to encourage MSMEs to acquire quality standards/certifications for processes and products, or any other international quality certification recognized in India by a competent authority. The government reimburses payments made to Consultancy and certification agencies for acquiring National and International Level Quality Certifications.
benefits: Reimbursement of payments made to Consultancy and Certification Agencies towards acquiring Quality Certification, subject to a ceiling of ₹ 2,00,000/- for National Level Certification and ₹ 10,00,000/- for International Level Certification.
eligibility: The applicant should be an MSME in the state of Tamil Nadu.
exclusions: Components of expenditure ineligible for reimbursement: travel expenditure, hotel accommodation, food & beverages, refreshment charges and surveillance charges.
Expenditure for renewal will not be eligible for reimbursement.
Certifications that are mandatory as per statutory requirements are also not eligible.
documents_required: Copy of Udyog Aadhaar Memorandum / Copy of Udyam Certificate.
Certificate of Registration under the Indian Partnership Act / LLP / Societies Registration Act / Certificate of Incorporation.
Proof for connected load, i.e., EB Meter card/online Statement.
Copy of invoices, cash bills, and stamped receipts.
Copy of the Registration Certificate with the National Accreditation Board for Certification Bodies (NABCB).

faqs.question: Are travel and accommodation expenses covered under the reimbursement scheme?
faqs.answer: No, travel, hotel accommodation, food & beverages, refreshment charges, and surveillance charges are excluded from reimbursement, focusing on direct certification-related expenses.

faqs.question: Is expenditure for the renewal of certifications eligible for reimbursement?
faqs.answer: No, expenditures for certification renewal are not eligible for reimbursement under this scheme, encouraging MSMEs to focus on obtaining new certifications.

faqs.question: Can certifications mandatory as per statutory requirements be reimbursed under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, certifications mandated by statutory requirements are not eligible for reimbursement under this scheme.

faqs.question: What components of expenditure are eligible for reimbursement under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Payments made for consultancy and certification agencies, as well as calibration and testing charges from NABL-accredited testing labs, are eligible for reimbursement.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the 'Grant of Quality Certification Reimbursement of Charges' scheme?
faqs.answer: Any MSME operating in the state of Tamil Nadu is eligible to apply and benefit from this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the significance of Udyam registration in the context of reimbursement under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Udyam registration is a prerequisite for MSMEs to avail themselves of reimbursement, emphasizing the government's focus on supporting small and medium enterprises.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on the types of certifications eligible for reimbursement?
faqs.answer: Certifications recognized by the Quality Council of India, including ISO standards, HACCP, and others, are eligible for reimbursement, ensuring conformity to internationally accepted quality benchmarks.

faqs.question: How does the scheme support MSMEs in scaling up their operations?
faqs.answer: MSMEs can claim reimbursement for new certifications when scaling up to the next category, providing financial support for growth and expansion.

faqs.question: What is the reimbursement limit for International Level Certifications under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The government reimburses payments up to ₹10,00,000/- for International Level Certifications recognized by globally accredited bodies, enhancing the global competitiveness of MSMEs.

faqs.question: Can a unit with a valid Udyam registration apply for multiple certifications under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, a unit with Udyam registration can obtain multiple certifications within the financial limits specified, promoting the acquisition of diverse quality certifications.

faqs.question: What are the specific quality standards or certifications that MSMEs are encouraged to acquire under the 'Grant of Quality Certification Reimbursement of Charges' scheme?
faqs.answer: MSMEs are encouraged to obtain certifications such as ISO 9000, ISO 14001, ISO 22000, HACCP, GHP, GMP, BIS Certification, ZED Rating, or any other international quality certification recognized in India by a competent authority.

faqs.question: Is the acquisition of multiple certifications limited to the mentioned standards, or can MSMEs pursue other international quality certifications?
faqs.answer: MSMEs can pursue any international quality certification recognized in India by a competent authority beyond the specified standards, broadening the scope for diversification in quality standards.
